title: EnglishPod 初级 英文播客 0211

segments.en: Hello, everyone, and welcome to EnglishPod.
My name is Marco.
And I am Catherine.
And today we have a fun, game-focused lesson for you.
segments.cn: 今天我们有一个有趣的以游戏为主题的课程。

segments.en: That's right.
Today we have an elementary lesson and it's all about playing board games.
segments.cn: 今天我们有一节初级课程，内容是关于玩桌游的。

segments.en: Okay, and the game in today's lesson is a famous one.
segments.cn: 好的，今天课程中的游戏是一个著名的游戏。

segments.en: It's called Monopoly.
Monopoly.
I don't know if you have this in your countries.
segments.cn: 我不知道你们国家是否有这个游戏。

segments.en: It's a game in which you try to earn money and sell property and buy property.
segments.cn: 这是一个你试图赚取金钱、出售和购买财产的游戏。

segments.en: That means hotels, houses, things like that.
Right.
And it's very, very famous.
We're going to learn more about this game today, so let's take a listen to our dialogue for the first time.
segments.cn: 今天我们将更多地了解这个游戏，所以让我们第一次听听我们的对话。

segments.en: Hey, why did you take that money?
You are such a cheater.
I should send you to jail.
I am not cheating.
When you pass go, you collect $200.
segments.cn: 当你经过起点时，你可以收集200美元。

segments.en: Everyone knows that.
Well, you can't just take the money.
You have to ask the bank for money.
And I'm the banker.
Banker?
Yes?
Can I have my $200, please?
Sure.
Here you are.
Thank you.
Please come again.
Now it's my turn to roll the dice.
All right, we're back.
So we saw some very interesting words there.
segments.cn: 我们看到了一些非常有趣的词汇。

segments.en: The dialogue is two people playing, so why don't we take a look at some of those words used in language takeaway.
segments.cn: 对话是两个人在玩，所以我们来看看一些在语言学习中使用的词汇。

segments.en: Language takeaway.
This first word we can hear when we play games, it's not a good thing to be, but it's very common.
segments.cn: 这个我们在玩游戏时可以听到的第一个词，虽然不是好事，但很常见。

segments.en: The word is cheater.
A cheater.
All right.
And that's a noun.
A person that is a cheater.
If somebody says you are a cheater, what does that mean?
segments.cn: 如果有人说你是个骗子，那是什么意思？

segments.en: This means the person is not honest at games.
segments.cn: 这意味着这个人在游戏中不诚实。

segments.en: For example, Marco, you and I are playing a card game, and you go to the bathroom.
segments.cn: 例如，Marco，你和我在玩纸牌游戏，你去洗手间。

segments.en: And then I take the cards I want.
segments.cn: 然后我拿走我想要的牌。

segments.en: I hide the cards I don't want.
segments.cn: 我把不想要的牌藏起来。

segments.en: That's called cheating.
Okay, the verb to cheat.
But here, a person who cheats is a cheater.
segments.cn: 但这里，作弊的人是一个骗子。

segments.en: Okay.
You're a cheater.
He's a cheater.
All right, and remember that you say cheater, right?
segments.cn: 好的，记住你说的是骗子，对吧？

segments.en: Because sometimes many people that are learning English would say you are a cheat, right?
segments.cn: 因为有时很多学习英语的人会说你是个作弊者，对吧？

segments.en: Cheater here is the noun.
That means it's the name of the person who does this.
segments.cn: 这意味着这是做这件事的人的名字。

segments.en: He is a cheater.
They are cheaters.
Okay.
And well, moving on, sometimes cheaters and people that steal things are sent to jail.
segments.cn: 而且，有时骗子和偷东西的人会被送进监狱。

segments.en: That's right.
So maybe if you go to a casino and you cheat, you use a cell phone or you use some kind of a computer device to win money.
segments.cn: 所以也许如果你去赌场作弊，使用手机或某种计算机设备来赢得金钱。

segments.en: This is called cheating, and the casino will send you to jail.
segments.cn: 这就叫作弊，赌场会把你送进监狱。

segments.en: All right, so jail is the place where people go.
segments.cn: 好的，所以监狱是人们去的地方。

segments.en: What's the difference between prison and jail?
segments.cn: 监狱和监禁有什么区别？

segments.en: Basically, they're the same thing.
segments.cn: 基本上，它们是同样的东西。

segments.en: Okay, so... Two words for the same thing.
segments.cn: 好的，所以... 两个词指的是同样的事情。

segments.en: People who break the law, people who do bad things, go to jail, not just cheaters.
segments.cn: 违法的人，做坏事的人，都会进监狱，不仅仅是骗子。

segments.en: All right, so now you have another word.
segments.cn: 好的，现在你有另一个词。

segments.en: Maybe you've seen that show, Prison Break, and so jail is pretty much the same thing, so the show could have been called Jail Break.
segments.cn: 也许你看过那个节目《越狱》，所以监狱基本上是同样的事情，所以这个节目可以叫做《监狱逃脱》。

segments.en: That's right, but yeah.
All right, so moving on, our third word is the person who's handling money says, well, you know what?
segments.cn: 好的，继续，我们的第三个词是处理金钱的人说，嗯，你知道吗？

segments.en: I'm the banker.
A banker.
Cheater, banker.
So you know already, a banker is probably a person.
segments.cn: 所以你已经知道，银行家可能是一个人。

segments.en: This is a job.
So a banker is a person who works at a bank.
segments.cn: 所以银行家是一个在银行工作的人。

segments.en: Okay, but what about the person that helps you when you go to the bank, like that gives you the money and the bank teller?
segments.cn: 好的，但当你去银行时，帮助你的人，比如给你钱的银行出纳员呢？

segments.en: It's not the same as a banker, right?
segments.cn: 这和银行家不一样，对吧？

segments.en: No, generally speaking, a person who gives you money and collects your money, this is a teller.
segments.cn: 不，一般来说，给你钱和收你钱的人是出纳员。

segments.en: A bank teller.
A bank teller, but a banker is someone who works in the bank to make big decisions, to invest money, to give loans.
segments.cn: 银行出纳员，但银行家是指在银行工作以做出重大决策、投资资金、发放贷款的人。

segments.en: Okay, so usually maybe managers or executives are bankers.
segments.cn: 好的，所以通常可能是经理或高管是银行家。

segments.en: That's right.
Okay, and moving on to our last word here, we have a verb, and that is to collect.
segments.cn: 好的，接下来我们最后一个词是一个动词，那就是收集。

segments.en: Right, so in the conversation between these two people, Karen the woman says, when you pass go, you collect $200.
segments.cn: 对，所以在这两个人的对话中，女人Karen说，当你经过起点时，你可以收集200美元。

segments.en: Okay, so to collect means to get.
segments.cn: 好的，所以收集意味着获取。

segments.en: That's right, to get or to take.
So at the end of every month, my landlord comes to my house to collect rent.
segments.cn: 所以在每个月的最后，我的房东会来我家收租。

segments.en: That means to take money from me for the house or the apartment.
segments.cn: 这意味着从我这里拿走房子或公寓的钱。

segments.en: Okay, good.
So now you have another way to say to get or to acquire.
segments.cn: 所以现在你有另一种说法来表示获取或获得。

segments.en: That's right.
All right, so very interesting.
Why don't we go back, listen to this dialogue again, and we'll take a look at all of these words that we just saw, and when we return, we'll take a look at some phrases.
segments.cn: 我们为什么不回去，再听一遍这个对话，看看我们刚才看到的所有这些词，然后我们回来看看一些短语。

segments.en: Sure, here you are, $200.
Thank you, please come again.
Now it's my turn to roll the dice.
All right, we're back.
So now let's take a look at three key phrases on Fluency Builder.
segments.cn: 现在让我们看看流利构建器上的三个关键短语。

segments.en: Marco, you're such a cheater.
Such a cheater.
I'm not a cheater, but what do you mean when you say you are such a cheater?
segments.cn: 我不是骗子，但你说你是个骗子是什么意思？

segments.en: So we know cheater, right?
segments.cn: 所以我们知道骗子，对吧？

segments.en: That's right, you could say this for many different things.
segments.cn: 没错，你可以用这个形容很多不同的事情。

segments.en: You're such a liar.
You are such a... Such a terrible person.
segments.cn: 你真是个……真是个可怕的人。

segments.en: You're such a bad person.
Normally we say this when we want to criticize someone, when we want to say something mean or negative.
segments.cn: 通常我们在想批评某人时会这样说，想说一些刻薄或负面的东西。

segments.en: You're such a means you're really a bad person.
segments.cn: 你真是个……意味着你真的是个坏人。

segments.en: You're really a cheater.
Right, so obviously because we are using a noun, we can't really use an adverb, right?
segments.cn: 对，所以显然因为我们使用的是名词，我们不能真的用副词，对吧？

segments.en: If you're saying an adjective like, I am very happy.
segments.cn: 如果你说形容词，比如，我很快乐。

segments.en: You can't say, you are very cheater.
segments.cn: 你不能说，你是个很骗子。

segments.en: No, no, no, you wouldn't say that.
You have to use a different sentence structure to give emphasis.
segments.cn: 你必须使用不同的句子结构来强调。

segments.en: So in this case you could say cheater.
segments.cn: 所以在这种情况下你可以说骗子。

segments.en: Right.
Okay, but that's not as strong, is it?
segments.cn: 好吧，但这不够强烈，是吗？

segments.en: As such a cheater.
You are such a cheater.
That means, gosh, you're a really big cheater.
segments.cn: 这意味着，天哪，你真是个大骗子。

segments.en: Right, exactly.
So this is the way that you would use that structure.
segments.cn: 所以这就是你使用那个结构的方式。

segments.en: Such a and then a noun that is describing this person, right?
segments.cn: 这样的和一个描述这个人的名词，对吧？

segments.en: You could also use it for positive statements like, you're such a good friend.
segments.cn: 你也可以用它来表示积极的陈述，比如，你真是个好朋友。

segments.en: Very good.
So then you are using the adjective.
You are such a good friend.
You're such a nice person.
Okay, excellent.
Alright, so moving on, we saw another interesting phrase when he said, well, you know what?
segments.cn: 好的，继续，我们看到另一个有趣的短语，当他说，嗯，你知道吗？

segments.en: You can't just take the money.
So what does he mean when he says can't just?
segments.cn: 那么他说不能只是是什么意思？

segments.en: Okay, we could say you can't take the money.
segments.cn: 好吧，我们可以说你不能拿钱。

segments.en: This is basically a rule.
You can't take the money, but you can't just take the money means there are other things you have to do before you take the money, okay?
segments.cn: 你不能拿钱，但你不能只是拿钱意味着在你拿钱之前还有其他事情要做，好吗？

segments.en: You have to, in this case, ask the banker for the money.
segments.cn: 在这种情况下，你必须向银行家请求钱。

segments.en: Or, for example, if I want to drive a car, I can't just go buy a car.
segments.cn: 或者，例如，如果我想开车，我不能只是去买车。

segments.en: I need to first get a driver's license.
segments.cn: 我需要先获得驾驶执照。

segments.en: I need to learn how to drive.
I need to register.
So you can't just.
Just here means there are some things we need to do before this happens.
segments.cn: 这里的只是意味着在这发生之前我们需要做一些事情。

segments.en: You can't just means you can't do these things that easily.
segments.cn: 你不能只是意味着你不能那么轻易地做这些事情。

segments.en: You have to do other things before it, as you said.
segments.cn: 你必须在之前做其他事情，正如你所说。

segments.en: Okay, so very interesting.
We will try to use that one in a sentence.
segments.cn: 我们会尝试在句子中使用那个。

segments.en: But moving on to our last phrase.
segments.cn: 但继续到我们的最后一个短语。

segments.en: When the person said, you know what, all right, you want your $200.
segments.cn: 当那个人说，你知道吗，好吧，你想要你的$200。

segments.en: Here you are.
Here you are.
So sometimes people think that this phrase means you are here.
segments.cn: 所以有时人们认为这个短语意味着你在这里。

segments.en: Right, which it could in some cases.
segments.cn: 对，这在某些情况下是可以的。

segments.en: Oh, yeah, that's right.
So basically you're saying, I found you.
segments.cn: 所以基本上你在说，我找到了你。

segments.en: Here you are.
I found you.
But in this case, this doesn't make sense.
segments.cn: 但在这种情况下，这没有意义。

segments.en: We're talking about money.
We're talking about a game.
So if you think about this, here you are.
segments.cn: 所以如果你考虑这个，给你。

segments.en: You can imagine someone is giving someone else a thing.
segments.cn: 你可以想象某人正在给另一个人一个东西。

segments.en: An object.
So in the case of the bank teller, remember we were talking about getting money at a bank?
segments.cn: 所以在银行出纳员的情况下，记得我们在谈论在银行取钱吗？

segments.en: A bank teller might say, here you are, sir, here's your money, and then give you some money.
segments.cn: 银行出纳员可能会说，给你，先生，这是你的钱，然后给你一些钱。

segments.en: So this is something we say in English when we give something to someone else.
segments.cn: 所以这是我们在英语中给别人东西时说的。

segments.en: Right, because otherwise, I guess it's strange if you just, you know, give something to someone and you don't say anything, right?
segments.cn: 对，因为否则，我想如果你只是，知道吗，把东西给某人而不说任何话，那很奇怪，对吧？

segments.en: You need to say something.
And if you say here, that's very rude.
segments.cn: 如果你说给你，那是非常无礼的。

segments.en: So this is a polite way to say, please take this.
segments.cn: 所以这是一个礼貌的方式来说，请拿这个。

segments.en: This is for you.
You might hear this at a restaurant.
segments.cn: 你可能会在餐厅听到这个。

segments.en: Here you are, here's your food.
Here you are.
Okay, it's a very useful phrase, and so I think it's time for us to listen to this dialogue again.
segments.cn: 好的，这是一个非常有用的短语，所以我认为是时候我们再听一遍这个对话了。

segments.en: And we'll be back to talk a little bit more.
segments.cn: 然后我们会回来再聊聊。

segments.en: Hey, why did you take that money?
You are such a cheater, I should send you to jail.
segments.cn: 你真是个骗子，我应该把你送进监狱。

segments.en: I am not cheating.
When you pass go, you collect $200.
segments.cn: 当你经过起点时，你会收集$200。

segments.en: Everyone knows that.
Well, you can't just take the money.
You have to ask the bank for money, and I'm the banker.
segments.cn: 你必须向银行请求钱，而我是银行家。

segments.en: Banker?
Yes?
Can I have my $200 please?
Sure, here you are, $200.
Thank you, please come again.
Now it's my turn to roll the dice.
Alright, we're back.
So a lot of interesting words there, a lot of interesting phrases.
segments.cn: 所以有很多有趣的单词，很多有趣的短语。

segments.en: They're really interesting and very useful, so remember to try and use such a... you can't just... or here you are when you're giving something to someone.
segments.cn: 它们真的很有趣且非常实用，所以记得尝试使用这样的... 你不能只是... 或者在给某人东西时说这里是。

segments.en: That's right, these are really great.
And I recommend also playing some games.
Games are a great way to improve your language skills.
segments.cn: 游戏是提高语言技能的好方法。

segments.en: A Monopoly, the game that they're playing in this dialogue, is a really fun one for numbers.
segments.cn: 大富翁，这个对话中他们正在玩的游戏，是一个非常有趣的数字游戏。

segments.en: Because the whole point of the game, the whole purpose of the game, is to make the most money.
segments.cn: 因为游戏的全部目的就是赚最多的钱。

segments.en: Right.
Of anyone playing.
And this is a really fun one because you get to buy houses and hotels and there's simple street names and place names.
segments.cn: 这是一个非常有趣的游戏，因为你可以购买房屋和酒店，还有简单的街道名称和地名。

segments.en: Like Park Avenue or the Boardwalk.
segments.cn: 比如公园大道或海滨大道。

segments.en: So you'll learn a lot of really great things about American culture and English.
segments.cn: 所以你会学到很多关于美国文化和英语的好东西。

segments.en: Yeah, it's a really good game, very popular.
segments.cn: 是的，这是一个非常好的游戏，非常受欢迎。

segments.en: I'm sure they have it in your language, but if you could get it in English, that would be really great.
segments.cn: 我相信他们的语言中也有这个，但如果你能找到英文版，那就太好了。

segments.en: And also another really good game to play with your friends to practice your vocab is Scrabble.
segments.cn: 还有另一个很好的游戏可以和朋友一起玩来练习词汇，就是拼字游戏。

segments.en: Scrabble, that's hard.
Scrabble is a game about words.
segments.cn: 拼字游戏是一个关于单词的游戏。

segments.en: And so basically you have to make words out of letters and whoever has the most interesting words, unique words, that person wins.
segments.cn: 基本上你需要用字母组成单词，谁的单词最有趣、最独特，谁就赢。

segments.en: So obviously it's a great game to improve your vocab because you also learn some words that maybe you didn't know before and your friends knew.
segments.cn: 所以显然这是一个提高词汇的好游戏，因为你还会学到一些你之前可能不知道而你的朋友知道的单词。

segments.en: So it's really fun to play.
segments.cn: 所以玩起来真的很有趣。

segments.en: Obviously don't play with any native English speakers because they might win.
segments.cn: 显然不要和任何以英语为母语的人玩，因为他们可能会赢。

segments.en: But it's a really cool game to play if you have any friends who are also learning English.
segments.cn: 但如果你有朋友也在学英语，那这是一个很酷的游戏。

segments.en: You can get together, play Scrabble, and it's a fun way to improve your vocab and to also fight a little bit because all the time some people are trying to make up new words that don't really exist.
segments.cn: 你们可以聚在一起，玩拼字游戏，这是提高词汇的有趣方式，也可以稍微竞争一下，因为总有一些人试图造出一些并不存在的新单词。

segments.en: We call them cheaters.
Cheaters.
So yeah, let us know about your game experiences.
segments.cn: 所以是的，告诉我们你的游戏经历。

segments.en: Do you like to play games?
Do you have a favorite game?
Practice some of these and let us know how they go.
segments.cn: 练习一些这些，告诉我们结果如何。

segments.en: Alright, we'll see you guys there.
EnglishPod.com.
Bye everyone.
Bye.
